question_text: What is the process of elimination in motherboard troubleshooting and how do you implement it effectively?
answer_options: Random removal of components without systematic approach
Systematically remove non-essential components to isolate problems - start with minimal configuration
Process of elimination only applies to software troubleshooting procedures
Immediately replace all components without testing individual parts
correct_answer: Systematically remove non-essential components to isolate problems - start with minimal configuration
explanation: Process of elimination for motherboards: 1) Start with minimal configuration (CPU, 1 RAM stick, power), 2) Test basic functionality, 3) Add components one at a time, 4) Test after each addition, 5) When problem appears, last added component is suspect, 6) Remove and retest to confirm. This isolates defective components and prevents damage from faulty parts.
